page.title: 11Mills
page.content: Formerly there were two working mills in the study area, the Mill of Stenness which had an undershot water wheel and the Mill of Tormiston with an overshot wheel. Both buildings are still standing today, the former used as a cattle shed by the farm of Housequoy; its wheel and machinery has gone.The wheel and machinery of Tormiston Mill still exist and are in excellent working condition but the mill itself has been turned into a gift shop and restaurant. Because of its location near the chambered tomb of Maeshowe,approximately 20 000 visitors pass through it annually and 12 staff are employed at peak periods. The mill was built of local stone and Welsh slate in 1882 and stopped working as a mill in l962.The restoration of the mill won for its owners a European Heritage Award.
